subject: Re: [junit] fileset wildcard question
msgSnippet: **/*Test.class finds all files named *Test.class in all recursive subdirectories of the base directory.  *Test.class finds only files named *Test.class in the
messageBody:
**/*Test.class finds all files named *Test.class in all recursive
subdirectories of the base directory. *Test.class finds only files
named *Test.class in the base directory. I'm not an expert, by any
stretch, in ant/junit integration, but my guess is that **/*Test.class
is finding more tests, once of which, sipenum.NAPTRTest, is failing.

David Saff

vpham2000 wrote:

> junit and ant newbie question, please help
>
> what is the difference between
> **/*Test.class vs *Test.class
>
> I name my test cases with the word Test
> at the end like OneTest.java, TwoTest.java etc ...
>
> when I run batchtest like this, it works
>
> <target name="runtests" depends="compiletests">
> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="true">
> <classpath refid="project.classpath" />
> <formatter type="brief" usefile="false" />
> <batchtest fork="yes">
> <fileset dir="build/test" includes="*Test.class" />
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
> <echo>runtests complete!</echo>
> </target>
>
> when I run batchtest like this, it does not work
>
> <target name="runtests" depends="compiletests">
> <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="true">
> <classpath refid="project.classpath" />
> <formatter type="brief" usefile="false" />
> <batchtest fork="yes">
> <fileset dir="build/test" includes="**/*Test.class" />
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
> <echo>runtests complete!</echo>
> </target>
>
> and it gave me these errors
>
> BUILD FAILED
> C:\SRDantdir\build.xml:60: Test sipenum.NAPTRTest failed
